intro: Zuccagnia eremophila, commonly known as the desert pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small pincushions. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. It has a compact, cushion-like growth habit with dense, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in harsh environments. Zuccagnia eremophila is well adapted to drought and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
